skill.name: executing-plans
skill.description: Use when you have a written implementation plan to execute in a separate session with review checkpoints
skill.summary: Use when you have a written implementation plan to execute in a separate session with review checkpo...
skill.author: Cycleaddict

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based methodology skill containing only documentation. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, environment variable access, or external command execution capabilities. The skill defines a workflow process for executing implementation plans.

content.value_statement: Implementation plans often fail when executed without structure. This skill provides a batch-based workflow with mandatory review checkpoints between work batches for safer, more collaborative development.
actual_capabilities: Load and critically review implementation plans before starting
Execute tasks in configurable batches with checkpoint reviews
Report progress showing implemented features and verification output
Stop and ask for clarification when encountering blockers
Integrate with sub-skills for branch completion workflows
limitations: Requires a pre-written implementation plan to function
Does not generate or create implementation plans
Relies on human partner for feedback between batches

use_cases.title: Implement Feature Branches
use_cases.description: Execute multi-step feature implementations with client feedback between batches

use_cases.title: Run Infrastructure Changes
use_cases.description: Deploy infrastructure changes safely with verification checkpoints

use_cases.title: Coordinate Team Implementations
use_cases.description: Guide AI assistants through complex project implementations with oversight

prompt_templates.title: Basic Plan Execution
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a plan file at [PATH]. I'm using the executing-plans skill to implement this. Please load the plan, review it, and start the first batch of tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Continue After Feedback
prompt_templates.prompt: I've reviewed your feedback on the previous batch. Please load the plan again and execute the next batch of tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Adjust Batch Size
prompt_templates.scenario: Change number of tasks per batch
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm using the executing-plans skill. Load the plan from [PATH]. This time, please execute [N] tasks per batch instead of the default of 3.

prompt_templates.title: Emergency Stop
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm using the executing-plans skill. I've hit a blocker: [DESCRIPTION]. The plan doesn't cover this scenario. Please stop execution and ask for guidance.

best_practices: Always review the plan critically before starting - flag any gaps or concerns upfront
Report verification output at each checkpoint to build trust with stakeholders
Stop immediately when blocked - never guess or make assumptions
anti_patterns: Executing an entire plan without checkpoints - increases risk of going off-track
Skipping verification steps - may miss bugs until much later
Continuing past blockers by guessing - leads to rework and frustration

faq.question: What is the default batch size?
faq.answer: The default batch size is 3 tasks. You can specify a different number when starting the skill.

faq.question: Can I use this skill without a written plan?
faq.answer: No. This skill requires a pre-written implementation plan. Use a planning skill first to create one.

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It uses the TodoWrite tool for progress tracking.

faq.question: Is my plan data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads plan files locally. No data is sent externally or stored elsewhere.

faq.question: What happens when verification fails?
faq.answer: Stop immediately and report the failure. Ask for guidance rather than continuing or making changes.

faq.question: How does this differ from direct implementation?
faq.answer: This skill adds structure through batches and checkpoints, requiring human review before continuing past each batch.
